alert.note: Alert for Bay; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 3:11PM EDT until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Saginaw River At Saginaw affecting Saginaw and Bay Counties. .Recent heavy rain has lead to rises on all contributing rivers into the Saginaw River. Strong westerly component winds will lower Saginaw Bay which in return will keep the crest of the Saginaw River lower then it would be with an easterly wind. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saginaw River At Saginaw. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 17.8 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
